entry.content:
This reverts commit 82789440feaede7a752d2f0dd6c3602e15105fb4.

entry.title: [LCPP] Always set LCPP hint
entry.content:
When we are committing the same RenderFrame as the previous document and

there's a pre-existing LCPP hint, and when there are no LCPP element

hints, we want to remove the existing hint. Hence this CL updates

SetLCPPHint() to clear the existing hint.

entry.title: iwa: Remove the GetParserForFile() function in WebBundleParserFactory.
entry.content:
After this CL we work with more abstract DataSource concept. There is

already an implementation of the DataSource interface for File in our

code base. So the interface function GetParserForFile() is redundant.

In addition the GetParserForFile() function violate Dependency Inversion

Principle: the implementation detail (WebBundleParser) tells

the higher level class (SafeWebBundleParser) in which process the file

should be read.



So far we read data only from Web Bundle files. So in theory we could

remove the GetParserForDataSource() interface function and leave

GetParserForFile(). But we decided to have a more abstract function

because of testing and future extensions of Web Bundles.



BUG=b/293861098

TEST=run tests



Change-Id: I1747dc43999a59935537d01823143c4c4514c3dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4733212

Commit-Queue: Oleksandr Peletskyi

Reviewed-by: Christian Flach

Reviewed-by: Ken Rockot

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178356}

entry.title: Make CronetSources aware of platform Cronet
entry.content:
Cronet from the platform is always loaded from the bootclassloader. This

makes it possible to directly implement CRONET_SOURCE_PLATFORM upstream,

without having to fork the code downstream: all we have to do is check

for the classloader of Cronet's implementation (similarly to what we do

for Google Play Services Cronet).



Bug: b:284972285

Change-Id: Ib2394d6efa95ed48196e9072ee3f8034eb01371d

entry.title: [Cookies] Remove old DB versions
entry.content:

Page names are determined during layout, which means that the size of

the first page might not be known before layout, which in turn means

that we need to relayout with the correct initial containing block size,

if we find out that the first page got named, and therefore got a

different size than what we thought initially.

entry.title: [PA] PartitionRefCount: Avoid negative mask.
entry.content:
In the PartitionRefCount, when reading parts of the bitfield, we use

some negative masks. This makes code more difficult to understand,

because we only know about what isn't read.



This patch replaces those locations with positive mask. In addition,

this applies some no-op changes:



1. ReleaseFromAllocator(): When checking for the existence of

raw_ptr<>, stop checking for kMemoryHeldByAllocatorBit and

kDanglingRawPtrDetectedBit. This is no-op change, because we

already know their values: 1 and 0 respectively.



2. IsAliveWithNoKnownRefs(): Stop reading the

kDanglingRawPtrDetectedBit bit. It doesn't really affect the

behavior, because if kMemoryHeldByAllocatorBit is true, then

`kDanglingRawPtrDetectedBit` is guaranteed to be false already.

@bartek spotted this.



Change-Id: Ic1f7d85130b044992641cdf474e29d751e4d1ccc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4729983

Reviewed-by: Bartek Nowierski

entry.title: Move ownership of CrdAdminSessionController up
entry.content:
Previously it was owned by the DeviceCommandsFactoryAsh,

which has always been a bit of a convenience choice and not really a

deliberate design,

so this CL moves it up to BrowserPolicyConnectorAsh, which is a more

logical parent since it already owns lots of components required for

the device cloud policy implementation.



Other changes in this CL:

* Move `DeviceCommandStartCrdSessionJob::Delegate` to a stand-alone

class `StartCrdSessionJobDelegate`, as that makes passing this

delegate along easier (since you can not forward declare nested

classes).

* Remove dependency of `DeviceCommandFactoryAsh` on

`DeviceCloudPolicyManagerAsh` (since it only needed a single field

of that class).



Bug: b:283091619

entry.title: dlp: Show desktop notif. when all files apps close
entry.content:
Ensures that any opened DLP panel items are moved to a desktop (system)

notification, in case all Files app windows close:

* Changes `IOTask::IsPaused()` to include tasks paused by DLP warning

* This then works because `IOTaskController::ProgressPausedTasks()`

force-sends a status update and the desktop notification is shown.

* For error notifications, i.e. when the task is blocked by DLP, we

don't track the task anymore in the controller, but we do have all the

info in `FilesPolicyNotificationManager`

* Adds a function in FPNM to loop over tracked IOTasks and show the

notifications for those with errors.

* Calls this function in the `FileManagerUI` dtor, when the last

instance is being destroyed.



The only case not covered is the timeout notification, as when this is

visible, the `FPNM` also doesn't track the task anymore, but it could

be fixed. However, it requires more changes in `FPNM` so will be done

in a separate CL if needed.



R=lucmult@chromium.org,chromeos-dlp@google.com

entry.title: Require main thread for LocalDOMWindow::AddConsoleMessageImpl
entry.content:
The purpose of this CL is really to eliminate the use of

CrossThreadPersistent in favor of CrossThreadHandle (Issue 1370013),

but it actually looks like this the off-thread path is never used,

at least not by tests.



Some code archaeology shows that this was originally added for

the now-deprecated WebSQL API [1], but the CL did not include

any tests.



Modern workers (e.g. paint worklets) are not supposed to directly

access the document/window on their thread, so we should probably

just try to remove this off-thread path.



Bug: 1370013



[1] c255e70137cd149724a2c626043b000ec97fa3bf

https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=71575

entry.title: Reset the NavigationRequest if its BFCache RFH is destroyed
entry.content:
Currently, the NavigationRequest will be reset along with the RFH

destruction only when the speculative RFH is selected as the final RFH

for the potential commit. It prevents use-after-free of the RFH member

from the NavigationRequest.



However, in the BFCache restore case, if the RFH for the restore is

destroyed before being selected as the final RFH, the

NavigationRequest will not be reset. Since we have changed the RFH for

BFCache to SafeRef from https://crrev.com/c/4707476, it may lead to

dereferencing an invalid pointer.



This CL restarts the BFCache NavigationRequest when the RFH used for

BFCache restore is destroyed, so the old NavigationRequest will be

reset.



Bug: 1468984

entry.title: Printing: Add support for mixed page sizes.
entry.content:
Although the printing code outside of Blink has supported mixed page

sizes for some time (in order to print PDFs with mixed page sizes, if

nothing else), the Blink layout engine lacked support for it, until now.



Document::GetPageDescription() had to be changed to accept a

ComputedStyle argument, rather than looking up the page name on its own.

Page names are determined during layout, so we cannot reliably look them

up during layout. NGPageLayoutAlgorithm will pass the page name to use,

via LayoutView::PageAreaSize(). Add a DCHECK to verify that layout is

complete before attempting to look up the page name for a given page

number. Some ancient test code that use GetPageDescription() is allowed

to call it before layout is finished. Make sure that we don't attempt to

look up page names in such cases.



Bug: 835358

entry.title: WTF: Support `CodePointIterator` for `String`
entry.content:
The `CodePointIterator` was introduced in crrev.com/c/3970278

for `StringView`. This patch supports it for `String`, and

add `String::begin()` end `String::end()` using it.



In a recent code review, one tried to use this by:

```

const String string;

for (const UChar32 ch : StringView(string)) { ... }

```

but this didn't work because the `StringView` instance is

destroyed early. This patch not only makes `String` and

`StringView` more consistent, but also avoids such errors.

entry.title: [Floss] SetPhoneOpsEnabled function when the BluetoothFlossTelephony feature flag is enabled/disabled
entry.content:
The UI must notify Floss to enable the telephony function in two cases:

1. When the user enables or disables BluetoothFlossTelephony on the UI.

2. When the user toggles the Bluetooth switch on the UI.



When the UI restarts, it will also reset the Floss adapter.

After the adapter client is ready,

it will send a dbus to the Bluetooth telephony interface to SetPhoneOpsEnabled.



BUG=b:289773128

TEST=enable/disable BluetoothFlossTelephony in chrome://flags.

TEST=dbus-monitor --system member=SetPhoneOpsEnabled check the methond is called.

TEST=autoninja -C out/Default/ device_unittests

TEST=./out/Default/device_unittests --gtest_filter="FlossBluetoothTelephonyClientTest*"

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in CardUnmaskPromptController test.
entry.content:
The dangling pointer fixed in this CL was purely a test artifact - the

test view did not reset its pointer to the controller on controller

destruction and closing the view was simulated without actually

destroying the view. The latter led the controller to set its view

pointer to null, which caused the view not to get informed on

controller destruction.



Finally, the CL splits up several tests, as they are independent.

entry.title: [GPU] Check `kCrashOnInProcessANGLEContextLoss` feature early
entry.content:
Check `kCrashOnInProcessANGLEContextLoss` to ensure registration within

the experiment - the check done at the time of MaybeExitOnContextLost()

doesn't cause clients in the enabled arm to become registered in the

experiment due to it being followed by an immediate crash. This means

that all users with ANGLE enabled and running the GPU service

in-process will be in the experiment regardless of whether they actually

hit MaybeExitOnContextLost(), which is actually beneficial as it will

allow us to see the global impact of the feature on behavior across

these users.



Bug: 1432913

entry.title: Fix Semantic Layout Extraction for prototyping.
entry.content:
"Semantic Layout Extraction" service of Screen AI is fixed to be ready

for prototyping:

1- If Layout Extraction flag is enabled, its functionality is

initialized after OCR is initialized, without having negative effect

on OCR initialization success.

2- If a screenshot is ready before initialization is completed, the

request is delayed 3 seconds before execution.



All changes are behind a disabled by default flag.

entry.title: xu_camera: Change GUID endianness to little-endian.
entry.content:
USB and UVC is a little-endian standard, and the UVC 1.5 spec is clear

that the byte-stream representation of GUID data structures shall be

little-endian: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9vAH6Q6q4YXxQUs



Calls to GetUnitId must now provide a little-endian GUID.

This change breaks backwards compatibility.



BUG=b:286092465

TEST=not tested

entry.title: fix view shadow offset
entry.content:
Sometimes the ViewShadow may have an incorrect offset as shown in:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4o83gD9j5PbewZd



This is because when setting bounds to a view's layer, it will move

shadow's layer to the view's origin. After that, if the view layer

target bounds changed, ViewShadow will recalculate the shadow layer

bounds. However, if the view layer target bounds are not changed,

for example when the view is reparented, the wrong offset will not

get fixed.



This cl fixed the issue by changing the name of

OnLayerTargetBoundsChanged to OnViewLayerBoundsSet and invoke it

when the view layer bounds is set. Making the ViewShadow override

this method to set shadow's content bounds with current layer bounds.



To guarantee the shadow layer bounds change with content bounds

accordingly, we add a attribute `last_layer_bounds_` to ui::Shadow to

cache the shadow's layer bounds after setting the content bounds. When

setting the same content bounds, if the shadow's layer bounds is

modified, we will reset the layer bounds.



Test: ShadowTest.ResetLayerBoundsBySettingSameContentBounds

Test: ViewShadowTest.NoShiftWhenReparentViewLayer

Bug: b:286568605

entry.title: Reland "Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon."
entry.content:
This reverts commit fdae4242269517798487e60f518336aeb5c53ac5.



Reason for revert: With a fix of initialization issue.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon."

>

> This reverts commit 3f230b34cb1c992a6fbb11132c17228619f06692.

>

> Reason for revert: Possible culprit for UAF errors in tests in

> builder: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests

>

> Original change's description:

> > Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon.

> >

> > In its GetInstance(), it keeps the raw ptr in its static local

> > variable, while it returns scoped_refptr.

> > When all scoped_refptrs referring the instance are destroyed,

> > the instance is also destroyed, so the static local pointer will

> > gets dangling pointer.

> > Fortunately, we didn't hit the case in production/tests,

> > but following fix of tests will hit the issue.

> >

> > This CL initializes/shutdowns explicitly to avoid the case.

> >

> > BUG=1325210

> > TEST=Tryjob

> >

> > Change-Id: I698968a9732aec09bdf294cb3ef08e2fde933488

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4730075

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapiVEA: Create scaled frames from the input frame
entry.content:
We create frames in spatial layers from the nearer resolution in the

layers [1]. This CL goes back to the original way of creating frames

from the input frame. It improves the quality and doesn't regress the

encoding time. The below is the PSNR in VP9 L3T1 encoding.



[dedede]

Before After

960x540

24.187 25.256

28.930 28.917

33.608 33.610

1280x720

26.450 26.738

31.231 31.232

37.518 37.509



[volteer]

Before After

960x540

26.440 27.292

31.852 31.862

33.618 33.612

1280x720

28.568 28.916

32.648 32.664

37.517 37.518



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3712050



Bug: b:290863300

Test: video_encode_accelerator_perf_tests --quality on dedede and volteer

entry.title: [Office upload] Use fake Drive classes in DriveUploadHandlerTest
entry.content:
Use FakeSimpleDriveFs and FakeSimpleDriveFsHelper in

DriveUploadHandlerTest to:

- SetMetadata() for a file being synced to fake Drive.

- GetMetadata() of a file on fake Drive.



This replaces the use to FakeDriveFs which differs in GetMetadata():

- FakeDriveFs: only returns FILE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND if the file is not in

local storage. It doesn't matter if there is no metadata for the file

on Drive.

- FakeSimpleDriveFs: returns FILE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND if there is no

metadata for the file on Drive.



FakeSimpleDriveFs is a better choice for the tests that will be

introduced in b/244396230 to check whether a file has been synced to

fake Drive or not based on the GetMetadata result.



Bug: b/244396230

Change-Id: I0f7bdeb22df8a0189b41e700826d138fa002986b

entry.title: inputs: Fix dead keys for crosh terminal.
entry.content:
Ash is not sending dead key events correctly. Right now, it sends

'Process' then 'Dead', but all other platforms do 'Dead' for both.



Fix this in Ash in the same way as Lacros [1], but limit the fix to

Terminal for now. If this rolls out without any issues, expand this

fix to every input.



Lacros has the correct behaviour, so also write a test to avoid

regressions.



We will also write a Tast test to verify this.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/base/ime/linux/input_method_auralinux.cc;l=102;drc=ed5118a7c8815b43eac050038844a68e77970c0f

entry.content:
New recorded UMAs: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.OneDrive



For both Drive and OneDrive, the `TaskResult` UMA now:

- Records "Failed to open", instead of only "Failed to upload"

"Open.UploadResult" UMA is recorded

- "Failed to open" are now recorded every time a (non-success)

"Errors" UMA is recorded

entry.title: Fix LayoutBox::MayIntersect() with overflow clip margin
entry.content:
A positive overflow clip margin can expose overflowing contents even

though we are clipping along both axes (i.e. OverflowClipRect() can

be larger than the border box rect).



LayoutBox::HasHitTestableOverflow() is added not only for this CL,

but also for crbug.com/1453975.

entry.title: [Office upload] Move fake Drive test classes to file_manager_test_util.h
entry.content:
Move FakeSimpleDriveFs and FakeSimpleDriveFsHelper

test classes to file_manager_test_util.h so they can be shared with

DriveUploadHandlerTest in a follow up CL, as well as DriveTest.



Update FakeSimpleDriveFs::SetMetadata() to have the same signature as

FakeDriveFs::SetMetadata() but the stored "metadata" is just the

alternate_url and the path which is all that matters for the upload

flow.



Update FakeSimpleDriveFs::GetMetadata() to return

FILE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND if there is no metadata for the file on Drive.



DriveUploadHandlerTest will need this for testing in b/244396230 to

check if a file has synced to drive (if the metadata has been set).

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4728581

entry.title: gif_recording: Fix a crash when recording type menu is out of bounds
entry.content:
In multi display scenarios, if the bounds of the user selected region

is set in such a way that the default bounds of the recording type

drop down menu (below the capture button widget) would be outside

the display bounds, then the wrong root window will be selected,

causing a crash when trying to adjust the stacking order.



This CL adjust the bounds, by trying to position the menu above

the capture button if the default below doesn't fit.



Fixed: b/293340894

Test: Manually, added a new test that fails without the fix.

entry.title: printscanmgr: switch client to proto interface
entry.content:
The existing printscanmgr_client is a direct port of the debugd

printscanmgr functionality, which used individual arguments like strings

and booleans for its D-Bus methods. Printscanmgr itself will use

protobuf arguments for all its D-Bus method arguments and responses.

This CL changes printscanmgr_client to use those protobufs.

entry.title: Prerender UKM: NavigationPredictorMetricsDocumentData
entry.content:
NavigationPredictorMetricsDocumentData obtains ukm::SourceId via

render_frame_host->GetMainFrame()->GetPageUkmSourceId(). But the

API returned invalid ukm::SourceId while prerendering.

As we are planning to change the API to have a CHECK on such call,

this patch modifies the call site to avoid calling it explicitly.

We cannot and should not record UKMs while prerendering due to

our data collection policy.

entry.content:

complexity and avoid excessive changes to ChromeOS flag support.



This feature is needed to support the Protected Audiences Bidding and

Auction API's User Consented Debugging flow.

entry.title: feedback: enable Jelly colors on dialog
entry.content:
The feedback dialog is still being used on OOBE and login screen.



- Add Jelly colors to the main form. Popups will be implemented in

followup CLs.

- Reuse the kOsFeedbackJelly flag to enable Jelly colors on CrOS.

- Support Jelly colors even when OSFeedback is disabled.

- The "Choose File" text comes from the built-it file input control.

Its style can't be changed via CSS.



Screenshots:

- Light Mode (different color sets):

entry.title: Reland "LayoutNG: Store LayoutOverflow in PhysicalFragmentRareData"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit c9331451261e21144839b361c0f040f072eac421

without any changes. The original CL was not guilty.



Original change's description:

> LayoutNG: Store LayoutOverflow in PhysicalFragmentRareData

>

> This CL changes the handling of LayoutOverflow.

> * Store LayoutOverflow in PhysicalFragmentRareData

> * Do not clone NGPhysicalBoxFragments on updating LayoutOverflow

>

> The `updated_layout_overflow` argument of CloneWithPostLayoutFragments()

> is not used after this CL.

>

> This CL has no user-visible behavior changes, but the new code is

> guarded by a runtime flag just in case.

>

entry.title: [Fuchsia] Add ssh_run.py to allow callers running a command via ssh
entry.content:
The newly added ssh_run.py is a very thin wrapper around ssh-based

functionalities to run a command against a fuchsia target via ssh. It

can be used as a standalone binary if the caller is not implemented by

python.

entry.title: [Homepage] Fix histograms with variants
entry.content:
Several recent histograms were set up with an external variant, but

the histograms lack the specifier to connect them.



This change simply adds the tag to those histograms in order

to fix them.



Also fix a typo.

entry.title: Revert "Deprecated shutdown metrics V1"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6a5b8a2bf336fa05dd1fdba5086f6f011ff44e86.



Reason for revert:

Sorry, this is failing Mac. First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac13%20Tests/2297/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Deprecated shutdown metrics V1

>

> The V1 set of metrics were using the local state prefs to keep

> the shutdown metrics until the next startup where they will be

> reported.

>

> A recent change in Chrome fixed the persistent memory for metrics.

> This means that UMA metrics macros are now working during shutdown.

>

> The V2 metrics are landed for months and are stable. We can deprecate

> the V1 set of metrics.

>

> Deprecate UMA metrics:

> * Shutdown.NotValid.Time

> * Shutdown.SilentExit.Time

> * Shutdown.WindowClose.Time

> * Shutdown.BrowserExit.Time

> * Shutdown.EndSession.Time

> * Shutdown.OtherExit.Time

>

> Deprecate the shutdown time file:

> * chrome_shutdown_ms.txt

>

> Deprecate local state prefs:

> * shutdown.num_processes

> * shutdown.num_processes_slow"

>

> OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS="Shutdown Metrics V1 are replaced by Shutdown Metrics V2"

>

> Bug: 1456205, 1468093

> Change-Id: I1a48b5b3e0b5791ef53152448c8cd096471d6308
